admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project is
            satisfactory. Several specific key lessons can be drawn from
            this project: a) Bureaucratic procurement processes were a
            leading cause of project implementation delays - Provincial
            Electricity Authority's bureaucratic and politicized
            procurement process resulted in a lengthy procurement cycle
            adding delays and unnecessary costs to projects that it
            undertakes. Speedier procurement processing and more
            coordinated and efficient inventory management and materials
            handling are key to increasing the efficiency of its
            investment program. b) Fragmented project team and
            coordination problems - A fully integrated project team
            could have mitigated many of the delays caused by
            insufficient coordination during implementation. c) Actions
            on land acquisition should be taken early on during
            preparation stage - To ensure smooth project implementation,
            land acquisition should be completed before the start of
            implementation, or a realistic and concrete time-bound
            action plan should be developed and followed through with
            close monitoring from both the Bank and the implementing agency.
